intro: Leptadenia brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, alternate leaves with a waxy surface. Its flowers are greenish-yellow and are borne in clusters, often accompanied by milky sap. Leptadenia brevipes is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with deep roots that help it access water from deeper soil layers.
